item.author: (Rik Nieu)

item.title: Read it later the hard way
item.description: There is a seemingly endless stream of articles we come across daily, and little time to read them. A quick glance at Hacker News in between tasks can yield half a dozen open tabs with articles to read at some point later. There are many services that help with this problem by maintaining a queue of these articles for you. You know the type: things like Instapaper or Pocket. In this article, we will build a service like that.

item.title: Boy Scouts’s bumbling CEOs cause inertia, leadership vacuum
item.description: Summary Thanks to a defective career-advancement system and a promote-from-within culture, BSA's CEO role is a reward for over-promoted, career-lifer, caretaker-style middle-managers. This starves BSA of leadership talent where it is most needed. The resulting leadership vacuum enables BSA's rudder to be controlled by two hands: the hand of inertia and the hand of throw-back...

item.title: Building a Signal Analyzer with Modern Web Tech
item.description: An overview of the design of a signal analyzer module for a browser-based digital audio workstation built with modern web tech. The post goes over the specific web tech used (things like SharedArrayBuffer, OffscreenCanvas, WebAssembly, etc.) as well as the code design patterns used to build the interactive visualizations.

item.title: Stop working for outsourcing companies as a software engineer
item.description: I’ve spent about three years in total working at two different outsourcing companies throughout my career. At my last such job, I led the back-end development of four different projects, made a decent amount of money and met lots of cool people. That’s pretty much it regarding the advantages. There are a lot more disadvantages than one can even imagine. I’ll try to break down the most critical. Context switching They always tell that you are going to work on a single project at a time.

item.title: Advent of Code vs LeetCode
item.description: I recently discovered the Advent of Code project for myself and I absolutely loved it. At first, it seemed similar to solving Leetcode problems. However, after trying it for a few days now I realized that I like the experience much more. In this short blog post I’ll try to break down main advantages that I see over Leetcode: No online editor You don’t have to use the poor built-in online editor.

item.title: Multi-Tenant Applications With EF Core
item.description: Most software applications today are built around the concept of multi-tenancy. One application serves multiple customers, while keeping their data isolated. You can approach multi-tenancy in two ways: - Single database & logical isolation of tenants - Multiple databases & physical isolation of tenants Which option you decide to use will depend mostly on your requirements. Some industries like healthcare require a high degree of data isolation, and using a database per tenant is a must. So how are we going to implement multi-tenancy support with EF Core? We can use Query Filters to apply a tenant filter to all database queries. Implement it once, and you can almost forget about it.
item.author: (Milan Jovanović)
